availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Barney Averback (Kenton County, Kentucky, feed store owner)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, feed store owner. Native of Prussia. Married to Frances Terlau Averback. Father of Mary Ann Averback and Molly Averbeck. Feed store owner in Kenton County in 1860. Hay dealer in Kenton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 2, p. 597.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 2, p. 1A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Enumeration District 130, p. 79B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 6th Congressional District, Vol. 3, June and July 1863, p. 143, (Accessed via ancestry.com on March 24, 2020).
Find A Grave, "Bernard “Barney” Averback (1828-1897)," Memorial 96324190, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/96324190/bernard-averbeck (accessed March 24, 2020).
